result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mohammed Faris

defendant.name: Faris, Mohammed
defendant.address: 363 West Lagoon Lane #1707, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mohammed Faris appeared by video.  Attorney Jorge R Fragoso appeared by video for Mohammed Faris.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Ayman Khativ.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense was recently appointed and needs information and files from past defense counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
$500 signature bond to continue. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Mohammed Faris in court.  Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court for Mohammed Faris.  Student Intern Madeline Witte appeared under the supervision of prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 30.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CORRECTION TO 10/10/2022 BENCH WARRANT: 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Mohammed Faris not in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status conference. Interpreter appeared in person. Defendant failing to appear. On the State's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Mohammed Faris appeared by video.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz appeared by video for Mohammed Faris.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant requests to discharge Attorney Klimetz as counsel. Defense makes motion to withdraw. Granted by the Court. Defendant to obtain new counsel.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Mohammed Faris in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense waives use of Arabic Interpreter for today's proceedings. Defense seeking DPA resolution. Case adjourned for status on TAD evaluation, Branch 30 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mohammed Faris in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mohammed Faris appeared by video means with Attorney.
Sworn as interpreter: Ayman Khatib.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. State will send discovery and offer to Defense. 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 065233,
Payable Number: 1019359,
Receipt Number: 22RP028177,
Amount: $20.00
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AH, AA, MH.

Defendant Mohammed Faris in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Ayman Khatib
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-24-2022 @2:30p
